page.title: 03FARMING IN CULMSTOCK
page.content: This is an area of 'mixed' farming which consists of dairy, beef and sheep farming, battery egg production and crop growing. Milking is done by machine on the farm and collected by milk tanker to be taken to a Factory. The farms - between 50 and 120 acres - are family-owned and worked by the farmer and his family, with much co-operation from neighbouring farmers regarding machinery and labour. Most cattle is Friesian, with Friesian Cross, (mainly with Hereford) kept for beef production. Primarily,fields are intensively- managed grassland for pasture or for cutting as grass, silage or hay; next are cultivated fields of mixed grain for animal feed, followed by enclosed rough grazing for cattle and sheep.
